newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian coconut oil falls, demand poor.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian coconut oil falls, demand poor.

text.p: Indonesian coconut oil prices softened on Friday amid prolonged sluggish consumer demand as fear of disturbances ahead of the May 29 general elections dampened market sentiment, traders said.

"Generally speaking, people are reluctant to trade ahead of the election. People are worried about possible violence, especially after several disturbances during the campaigning period," said one trader in Jakarta.
She said demand for coconut oil from processing firms also was slow as many buyers were reluctant to take positions.
Traders said coconut oil fell to 1,500 rupiah/kg in Jakarta against 1,700 rupiah last week. Copra was stable at 750 rupiah/kg in Jakarta.

Traders in Manila said on Monday coconut oil prices are likely to continue falling this week due to rising copra output in the Philippines and Indonesia and the abundance of substitutes such as palm and soyoil.
